definition: to light a fire for cooking
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious

sentences.english: Her head and back felt on fire.
sentences.chinese: 她的头和背感到火烧火燎的。

sentences.english: Burning fire dragon in Huanglongxi dated back to the Southern Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 黄龙溪烧火龙起源于南宋时期。

sentences.english: The factory's firemen went on strike, and there was no one to  fire for them.
sentences.chinese: 工厂的司炉工在闹罢工，没有人替他们烧火。

sentences.english: His tongue was stung by hot food.
sentences.chinese: 他的舌头被辛辣食品辣得火烧火燎的。

sentences.english: My your home a wenches for establishing a fire can easily kill her.
sentences.chinese: 我府上一个烧火的丫头都能轻松打死她。

sentences.english: He picked up a poker and demonstrated.
sentences.chinese: 他摘下一根烧火棍开始做示范。

sentences.english: As a vine cut down is fit for nothing but the fire.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄藤砍倒了只能烧火。

sentences.english: While in flames, he grabbed a roll of lottery tickets and fled.
sentences.chinese: 火烧火燎中，他抓了了一卷彩票逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: Take these stalks back to burn.
sentences.chinese: 把这些秆子带回去烧火。

sentences.english: He was chopping wood into small, short pieces for burning.
sentences.chinese: 他将木头砍成小而短的木片，作为烧火之用。

sentences.english: We began to light up the fire and cook our meal.
Be sure to use with the wood axe for some old-fashioned wood fire grill and wash thoroughly before using it for meals.
sentences.chinese: 请务必在用斧头劈柴烧火做饭前，把它清洗干净。

sentences.english: There tanks are junk and there guns are cheap plinkers.
sentences.chinese: 他们的坦克都是垃圾，枪是烧火棍。

sentences.english: At that time, a Shaohuo Monk "-'word for that, given Shiyi Shou ."
sentences.chinese: 当时，有一烧火僧以“半’字为题，赋诗一首。

sentences.english: Their son Aniu lit the fire.
They have an opening at the bottom for the fire and a place on top to put a pot.
sentences.chinese: 它们的底部有开口烧火，在上部有开口放锅。

definition: to make a fire/to light a fire
large kitchen stove made from bricks or earth/(PRC) ordinary mess hall (lowest dining standard, ranked below 中灶[zhong1 zao4] for mid-level cadres and 小灶[xiao3 zao4] for the most privileged)
kang (a heatable brick bed)/to bake/to dry by the heat of a fire
to warm oneself at a fire
